GEF4 Geometry

Uses of Package
org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes

Packages that use org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes
org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.convert Provides support for converting geometric objects to AWT and SWT. 
org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes Provides support for geometric calculations based on shapes. 
org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.utils Provides utility classes being used internally for geometric calculations. 
 

Classes in org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes used by org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.convert
Line
          Represents the geometric shape of a line (or linear curve).
Rectangle
          Represents the geometric shape of a rectangle, where a rectangle is characterized by means of its upper left corner (x,y) and its size (width, height).
RoundedRectangle
          Represents the geometric shape of a rounded rectangle, i.e. a rectangle with rounded corners.
 

Classes in org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes used by org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes
CubicCurve
          Represents the geometric shape of a cubic Bézier curve.
Ellipse
          Represents the geometric shape of an ellipse, which is defined by means of its enclosing framing rectangle.
Geometry
          Common abstraction over all geometric shapes.
Line
          Represents the geometric shape of a line (or linear curve).
Path
          Represents the geometric shape of a path, which may consist of independent subgraphs.
Polygon
          Represents the geometric shape of a convex polygon.
Polyline
          Represents the geometric shape of a polyline.
QuadraticCurve
          Represents the geometric shape of a quadratic Bézier curve.
Rectangle
          Represents the geometric shape of a rectangle, where a rectangle is characterized by means of its upper left corner (x,y) and its size (width, height).
 

Classes in org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes used by org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.utils
Line
          Represents the geometric shape of a line (or linear curve).
Rectangle
          Represents the geometric shape of a rectangle, where a rectangle is characterized by means of its upper left corner (x,y) and its size (width, height).
